snippet: Valentin V. Danilov, sentenced in 2004 to 14 years in prison for treason, will be released next week because of health considerations and good behavior, a court spokeswoman said
abstract: Russian court orders parole of Valentin V Danilov, physicist convicted in 2004 of selling China secret information about satellites; rights activists had called case part of crackdown on scientists working with foreigners.
lead_paragraph: Valentin V. Danilov, sentenced in 2004 to 14 years in prison for treason, will be released next week because of health considerations and good behavior, a court spokeswoman said

headline.main: Russia: Physicist Accused of Selling Secrets Is Paroled
headline.print_headline: Russia: Physicist Accused of Selling Secrets Is Paroled
